definition: certainly/also written 一準|一准[yi1 zhun3]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: I promised faithfully to be home at six.
sentences.chinese: 我答应过6点钟一准回家的。

sentences.english: Your physique good, understood at a glance one lives dies.
sentences.chinese: 您体格好啊，一看就知道一准儿活到死。

sentences.english: He must have known what was coming.
sentences.chinese: 他一准是早就知道了接下来就要丢脸了。

sentences.english: Well, you're goin a go where you look.
You like it here, don't you, Huck?
sentences.chinese: 你一准喜欢这儿，对不对，哈克？

definition: more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
it'd be a wonder if... (following a verb phrase that is usually negative)
in a moment/later/also pr. [dai1 hui3 r5] or [dai1 hui5 r5]
lit. if you can't eat it all, you'll have to take it home (idiom)/fig. you'll have to take the consequences
pinyin: chi1 bu5 liao3 dou1 zhe5 zou3
